2773 * the bond has an IP address)
2774 */
2775 trans_start = dev_trans_start(slave->dev);
2776 if (bond_is_active_slave(slave) &&
2777 (!bond_time_in_interval(bond, trans_start, 2) ||
2778 !bond_time_in_interval(bond, last_rx, 2))) {
2779 slave->new_link = BOND_LINK_DOWN;
2780 commit++;
2781 }
2782 }
2783
2784 return commit;
2785}
2786
2787/* Called to commit link state changes noted by inspection step of
2788 * active-backup mode ARP monitor.
2789 *
2790 * Called with RTNL hold.
2791 */
2792static void bond_ab_arp_commit(struct bonding *bond)
2793{
2794 unsigned long trans_start;
2795 struct list_head *iter;
2796 struct slave *slave;
2797
2798 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
2799 switch (slave->new_link) {
2800 case BOND_LINK_NOCHANGE:
2801 continue;
2802
2803 case BOND_LINK_UP:
2804 trans_start = dev_trans_start(slave->dev);
2805 if (rtnl_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave) != slave ||
2806 (!rtnl_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave) &&
2807 bond_time_in_interval(bond, trans_start, 1))) {
2808 struct slave *current_arp_slave;
2809
2810 current_arp_slave = rtnl_dereference(bond->current_arp_slave);
2811 bond_set_slave_link_state(slave, BOND_LINK_UP,
2812 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
2813 if (current_arp_slave) {
2814 bond_set_slave_inactive_flags(
2815 current_arp_slave,
2816 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
2817 RCU_INIT_POINTER(bond->current_arp_slave, NULL);
2818 }
2819
2820 netdev_info(bond->dev, "link status definitely up for interface %s\n",
2821 slave->dev->name);
2822
2823 if (!rtnl_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave) ||
2824 slave == rtnl_dereference(bond->primary_slave))
2825 goto do_failover;
2826
2827 }
2828
2829 continue;
2830
2831 case BOND_LINK_DOWN:
2832 if (slave->link_failure_count < UINT_MAX)
2833 slave->link_failure_count++;
2834
2835 bond_set_slave_link_state(slave, BOND_LINK_DOWN,
2836 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
2837 bond_set_slave_inactive_flags(slave,
2838 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
2839
2840 netdev_info(bond->dev, "link status definitely down for interface %s, disabling it\n",
2841 slave->dev->name);
2842
2843 if (slave == rtnl_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave)) {
2844 RCU_INIT_POINTER(bond->current_arp_slave, NULL);
2845 goto do_failover;
2846 }
2847
2848 continue;
2849
2850 default:
2851 netdev_err(bond->dev, "impossible: new_link %d on slave %s\n",
2852 slave->new_link, slave->dev->name);
2853 continue;
2854 }
2855
2856do_failover:
2857 block_netpoll_tx();
2858 bond_select_active_slave(bond);
2859 unblock_netpoll_tx();
2860 }
2861
2862 bond_set_carrier(bond);
2863}
2864
2865/* Send ARP probes for active-backup mode ARP monitor.
2866 *
2867 * Called with rcu_read_lock held.
2868 */
2869static bool bond_ab_arp_probe(struct bonding *bond)
2870{
2871 struct slave *slave, *before = NULL, *new_slave = NULL,
2872 *curr_arp_slave = rcu_dereference(bond->current_arp_slave),
2873 *curr_active_slave = rcu_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave);
2874 struct list_head *iter;
2875 bool found = false;
2876 bool should_notify_rtnl = BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER;
2877
2878 if (curr_arp_slave && curr_active_slave)
2879 netdev_info(bond->dev, "PROBE: c_arp %s && cas %s BAD\n",
2880 curr_arp_slave->dev->name,
2881 curr_active_slave->dev->name);
2882
2883 if (curr_active_slave) {
2884 bond_arp_send_all(bond, curr_active_slave);
2885 return should_notify_rtnl;
2886 }
2887
2888 /* if we don't have a curr_active_slave, search for the next available
2889 * backup slave from the current_arp_slave and make it the candidate
2890 * for becoming the curr_active_slave
2891 */
2892
2893 if (!curr_arp_slave) {
2894 curr_arp_slave = bond_first_slave_rcu(bond);
2895 if (!curr_arp_slave)
2896 return should_notify_rtnl;
2897 }
2898
2899 bond_set_slave_inactive_flags(curr_arp_slave, BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER);
2900
2901 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
2902 if (!found && !before && bond_slave_is_up(slave))
2903 before = slave;
2904
2905 if (found && !new_slave && bond_slave_is_up(slave))
2906 new_slave = slave;
2907 /* if the link state is up at this point, we
2908 * mark it down - this can happen if we have
2909 * simultaneous link failures and
2910 * reselect_active_interface doesn't make this
2911 * one the current slave so it is still marked
2912 * up when it is actually down
2913 */
2914 if (!bond_slave_is_up(slave) && slave->link == BOND_LINK_UP) {
2915 bond_set_slave_link_state(slave, BOND_LINK_DOWN,
2916 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER);
2917 if (slave->link_failure_count < UINT_MAX)
2918 slave->link_failure_count++;
2919
2920 bond_set_slave_inactive_flags(slave,
2921 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER);
2922
2923 netdev_info(bond->dev, "backup interface %s is now down\n",
2924 slave->dev->name);
2925 }
2926 if (slave == curr_arp_slave)
2927 found = true;
2928 }
2929
2930 if (!new_slave && before)
2931 new_slave = before;
2932
2933 if (!new_slave)
2934 goto check_state;
2935
2936 bond_set_slave_link_state(new_slave, BOND_LINK_BACK,
2937 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER);
2938 bond_set_slave_active_flags(new_slave, BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_LATER);
2939 bond_arp_send_all(bond, new_slave);
2940 new_slave->last_link_up = jiffies;
2941 rcu_assign_pointer(bond->current_arp_slave, new_slave);
2942
2943check_state:
2944 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
2945 if (slave->should_notify || slave->should_notify_link) {
2946 should_notify_rtnl = BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW;
2947 break;
2948 }
2949 }
2950 return should_notify_rtnl;
2951}
2952
2953static void bond_activebackup_arp_mon(struct bonding *bond)
2954{
2955 bool should_notify_peers = false;
2956 bool should_notify_rtnl = false;
2957 int delta_in_ticks;
2958
2959 delta_in_ticks = msecs_to_jiffies(bond->params.arp_interval);
2960
2961 if (!bond_has_slaves(bond))
2962 goto re_arm;
2963
2964 rcu_read_lock();
2965
2966 should_notify_peers = bond_should_notify_peers(bond);
2967
2968 if (bond_ab_arp_inspect(bond)) {
2969 rcu_read_unlock();
2970
2971 /* Race avoidance with bond_close flush of workqueue */
2972 if (!rtnl_trylock()) {
2973 delta_in_ticks = 1;
2974 should_notify_peers = false;
2975 goto re_arm;
2976 }
2977
2978 bond_ab_arp_commit(bond);
2979
2980 rtnl_unlock();
2981 rcu_read_lock();
2982 }
2983
2984 should_notify_rtnl = bond_ab_arp_probe(bond);
2985 rcu_read_unlock();
2986
2987re_arm:
2988 if (bond->params.arp_interval)
2989 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->arp_work, delta_in_ticks);
2990
2991 if (should_notify_peers || should_notify_rtnl) {
2992 if (!rtnl_trylock())
2993 return;
2994
2995 if (should_notify_peers)
2996 call_netdevice_notifiers(NETDEV_NOTIFY_PEERS,
2997 bond->dev);
2998 if (should_notify_rtnl) {
2999 bond_slave_state_notify(bond);
3000 bond_slave_link_notify(bond);
3001 }
3002
3003 rtnl_unlock();
3004 }
3005}
3006
3007static void bond_arp_monitor(struct work_struct *work)
3008{
3009 struct bonding *bond = container_of(work, struct bonding,
3010 arp_work.work);
3011
3012 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_ACTIVEBACKUP)
3013 bond_activebackup_arp_mon(bond);
3014 else
3015 bond_loadbalance_arp_mon(bond);
3016}
3017
3018/*-------------------------- netdev event handling --------------------------*/
3019
3020/* Change device name */
3021static int bond_event_changename(struct bonding *bond)
3022{
3023 bond_remove_proc_entry(bond);
3024 bond_create_proc_entry(bond);
3025
3026 bond_debug_reregister(bond);
3027
3028 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3029}
3030
3031static int bond_master_netdev_event(unsigned long event,
3032 struct net_device *bond_dev)
3033{
3034 struct bonding *event_bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3035
3036 switch (event) {
3037 case NETDEV_CHANGENAME:
3038 return bond_event_changename(event_bond);
3039 case NETDEV_UNREGISTER:
3040 bond_remove_proc_entry(event_bond);
3041 break;
3042 case NETDEV_REGISTER:
3043 bond_create_proc_entry(event_bond);
3044 break;
3045 case NETDEV_NOTIFY_PEERS:
3046 if (event_bond->send_peer_notif)
3047 event_bond->send_peer_notif--;
3048 break;
3049 default:
3050 break;
3051 }
3052
3053 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3054}
3055
3056static int bond_slave_netdev_event(unsigned long event,
3057 struct net_device *slave_dev)
3058{
3059 struct slave *slave = bond_slave_get_rtnl(slave_dev), *primary;
3060 struct bonding *bond;
3061 struct net_device *bond_dev;
3062
3063 /* A netdev event can be generated while enslaving a device
3064 * before netdev_rx_handler_register is called in which case
3065 * slave will be NULL
3066 */
3067 if (!slave)
3068 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3069 bond_dev = slave->bond->dev;
3070 bond = slave->bond;
3071 primary = rtnl_dereference(bond->primary_slave);
3072
3073 switch (event) {
3074 case NETDEV_UNREGISTER:
3075 if (bond_dev->type != ARPHRD_ETHER)
3076 bond_release_and_destroy(bond_dev, slave_dev);
3077 else
3078 __bond_release_one(bond_dev, slave_dev, false, true);
3079 break;
3080 case NETDEV_UP:
3081 case NETDEV_CHANGE:
3082 bond_update_speed_duplex(slave);
3083 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_8023AD)
3084 bond_3ad_adapter_speed_duplex_changed(slave);
3085 /* Fallthrough */
3086 case NETDEV_DOWN:
3087 /* Refresh slave-array if applicable!
3088 * If the setup does not use miimon or arpmon (mode-specific!),
3089 * then these events will not cause the slave-array to be
3090 * refreshed. This will cause xmit to use a slave that is not
3091 * usable. Avoid such situation by refeshing the array at these
3092 * events. If these (miimon/arpmon) parameters are configured
3093 * then array gets refreshed twice and that should be fine!
3094 */
3095 if (bond_mode_uses_xmit_hash(bond))
3096 bond_update_slave_arr(bond, NULL);
3097 break;
3098 case NETDEV_CHANGEMTU:
3099 /* TODO: Should slaves be allowed to
3100 * independently alter their MTU? For
3101 * an active-backup bond, slaves need
3102 * not be the same type of device, so
3103 * MTUs may vary. For other modes,
3104 * slaves arguably should have the
3105 * same MTUs. To do this, we'd need to
3106 * take over the slave's change_mtu
3107 * function for the duration of their
3108 * servitude.
3109 */
3110 break;
3111 case NETDEV_CHANGENAME:
3112 /* we don't care if we don't have primary set */
3113 if (!bond_uses_primary(bond) ||
3114 !bond->params.primary[0])
3115 break;
3116
3117 if (slave == primary) {
3118 /* slave's name changed - he's no longer primary */
3119 RCU_INIT_POINTER(bond->primary_slave, NULL);
3120 } else if (!strcmp(slave_dev->name, bond->params.primary)) {
3121 /* we have a new primary slave */
3122 rcu_assign_pointer(bond->primary_slave, slave);
3123 } else { /* we didn't change primary - exit */
3124 break;
3125 }
3126
3127 netdev_info(bond->dev, "Primary slave changed to %s, reselecting active slave\n",
3128 primary ? slave_dev->name : "none");
3129
3130 block_netpoll_tx();
3131 bond_select_active_slave(bond);
3132 unblock_netpoll_tx();
3133 break;
3134 case NETDEV_FEAT_CHANGE:
3135 bond_compute_features(bond);
3136 break;
3137 case NETDEV_RESEND_IGMP:
3138 /* Propagate to master device */
3139 call_netdevice_notifiers(event, slave->bond->dev);
3140 break;
3141 default:
3142 break;
3143 }
3144
3145 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3146}
3147
3148/* bond_netdev_event: handle netdev notifier chain events.
3149 *
3150 * This function receives events for the netdev chain. The caller (an
3151 * ioctl handler calling blocking_notifier_call_chain) holds the necessary
3152 * locks for us to safely manipulate the slave devices (RTNL lock,
3153 * dev_probe_lock).
3154 */
3155static int bond_netdev_event(struct notifier_block *this,
3156 unsigned long event, void *ptr)
3157{
3158 struct net_device *event_dev = netdev_notifier_info_to_dev(ptr);
3159
3160 netdev_dbg(event_dev, "event: %lx\n", event);
3161
3162 if (!(event_dev->priv_flags & IFF_BONDING))
3163 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3164
3165 if (event_dev->flags & IFF_MASTER) {
3166 netdev_dbg(event_dev, "IFF_MASTER\n");
3167 return bond_master_netdev_event(event, event_dev);
3168 }
3169
3170 if (event_dev->flags & IFF_SLAVE) {
3171 netdev_dbg(event_dev, "IFF_SLAVE\n");
3172 return bond_slave_netdev_event(event, event_dev);
3173 }
3174
3175 return NOTIFY_DONE;
3176}
3177
3178static struct notifier_block bond_netdev_notifier = {
3179 .notifier_call = bond_netdev_event,
3180};
3181
3182/*---------------------------- Hashing Policies -----------------------------*/
3183
3184/* L2 hash helper */
3185static inline u32 bond_eth_hash(struct sk_buff *skb)
3186{
3187 struct ethhdr *ep, hdr_tmp;
3188
3189 ep = skb_header_pointer(skb, 0, sizeof(hdr_tmp), &hdr_tmp);
3190 if (ep)
3191 return ep->h_dest[5] ^ ep->h_source[5] ^ ep->h_proto;
3192 return 0;
3193}
3194
3195/* Extract the appropriate headers based on bond's xmit policy */
3196static bool bond_flow_dissect(struct bonding *bond, struct sk_buff *skb,
3197 struct flow_keys *fk)
3198{
3199 const struct ipv6hdr *iph6;
3200 const struct iphdr *iph;
3201 int noff, proto = -1;
3202
3203 if (bond->params.xmit_policy > BOND_XMIT_POLICY_LAYER23)
3204 return skb_flow_dissect_flow_keys(skb, fk, 0);
3205
3206 fk->ports.ports = 0;
3207 noff = skb_network_offset(skb);
3208 if (skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IP)) {
3209 if (unlikely(!pskb_may_pull(skb, noff + sizeof(*iph))))
3210 return false;
3211 iph = ip_hdr(skb);
3212 iph_to_flow_copy_v4addrs(fk, iph);
3213 noff += iph->ihl << 2;
3214 if (!ip_is_fragment(iph))
3215 proto = iph->protocol;
3216 } else if (skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IPV6)) {
3217 if (unlikely(!pskb_may_pull(skb, noff + sizeof(*iph6))))
3218 return false;
3219 iph6 = ipv6_hdr(skb);
3220 iph_to_flow_copy_v6addrs(fk, iph6);
3221 noff += sizeof(*iph6);
3222 proto = iph6->nexthdr;
3223 } else {
3224 return false;
3225 }
3226 if (bond->params.xmit_policy == BOND_XMIT_POLICY_LAYER34 && proto >= 0)
3227 fk->ports.ports = skb_flow_get_ports(skb, noff, proto);
3228
3229 return true;
3230}
3231
3232/**
3233 * bond_xmit_hash - generate a hash value based on the xmit policy
3234 * @bond: bonding device
3235 * @skb: buffer to use for headers
3236 *
3237 * This function will extract the necessary headers from the skb buffer and use
3238 * them to generate a hash based on the xmit_policy set in the bonding device
3239 */
3240u32 bond_xmit_hash(struct bonding *bond, struct sk_buff *skb)
3241{
3242 struct flow_keys flow;
3243 u32 hash;
3244
3245 if (bond->params.xmit_policy == BOND_XMIT_POLICY_ENCAP34 &&
3246 skb->l4_hash)
3247 return skb->hash;
3248
3249 if (bond->params.xmit_policy == BOND_XMIT_POLICY_LAYER2 ||
3250 !bond_flow_dissect(bond, skb, &flow))
3251 return bond_eth_hash(skb);
3252
3253 if (bond->params.xmit_policy == BOND_XMIT_POLICY_LAYER23 ||
3254 bond->params.xmit_policy == BOND_XMIT_POLICY_ENCAP23)
3255 hash = bond_eth_hash(skb);
3256 else
3257 hash = (__force u32)flow.ports.ports;
3258 hash ^= (__force u32)flow_get_u32_dst(&flow) ^
3259 (__force u32)flow_get_u32_src(&flow);
3260 hash ^= (hash >> 16);
3261 hash ^= (hash >> 8);
3262
3263 return hash >> 1;
3264}
3265
3266/*-------------------------- Device entry points ----------------------------*/
3267
3268void bond_work_init_all(struct bonding *bond)
3269{
3270 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->mcast_work,
3271 bond_resend_igmp_join_requests_delayed);
3272 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->alb_work, bond_alb_monitor);
3273 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->mii_work, bond_mii_monitor);
3274 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->arp_work, bond_arp_monitor);
3275 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->ad_work, bond_3ad_state_machine_handler);
3276 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bond->slave_arr_work, bond_slave_arr_handler);
3277}
3278
3279static void bond_work_cancel_all(struct bonding *bond)
3280{
3281 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->mii_work);
3282 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->arp_work);
3283 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->alb_work);
3284 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->ad_work);
3285 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->mcast_work);
3286 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&bond->slave_arr_work);
3287}
3288
3289static int bond_open(struct net_device *bond_dev)
3290{
3291 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3292 struct list_head *iter;
3293 struct slave *slave;
3294
3295 /* reset slave->backup and slave->inactive */
3296 if (bond_has_slaves(bond)) {
3297 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
3298 if (bond_uses_primary(bond) &&
3299 slave != rcu_access_pointer(bond->curr_active_slave)) {
3300 bond_set_slave_inactive_flags(slave,
3301 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
3302 } else if (BOND_MODE(bond) != BOND_MODE_8023AD) {
3303 bond_set_slave_active_flags(slave,
3304 BOND_SLAVE_NOTIFY_NOW);
3305 }
3306 }
3307 }
3308
3309 if (bond_is_lb(bond)) {
3310 /* bond_alb_initialize must be called before the timer
3311 * is started.
3312 */
3313 if (bond_alb_initialize(bond, (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_ALB)))
3314 return -ENOMEM;
3315 if (bond->params.tlb_dynamic_lb)
3316 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->alb_work, 0);
3317 }
3318
3319 if (bond->params.miimon) /* link check interval, in milliseconds. */
3320 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->mii_work, 0);
3321
3322 if (bond->params.arp_interval) { /* arp interval, in milliseconds. */
3323 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->arp_work, 0);
3324 bond->recv_probe = bond_arp_rcv;
3325 }
3326
3327 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_8023AD) {
3328 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->ad_work, 0);
3329 /* register to receive LACPDUs */
3330 bond->recv_probe = bond_3ad_lacpdu_recv;
3331 bond_3ad_initiate_agg_selection(bond, 1);
3332 }
3333
3334 if (bond_mode_uses_xmit_hash(bond))
3335 bond_update_slave_arr(bond, NULL);
3336
3337 return 0;
3338}
3339
3340static int bond_close(struct net_device *bond_dev)
3341{
3342 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3343
3344 bond_work_cancel_all(bond);
3345 bond->send_peer_notif = 0;
3346 if (bond_is_lb(bond))
3347 bond_alb_deinitialize(bond);
3348 bond->recv_probe = NULL;
3349
3350 return 0;
3351}
3352
3353/* fold stats, assuming all rtnl_link_stats64 fields are u64, but
3354 * that some drivers can provide 32bit values only.
3355 */
3356static void bond_fold_stats(struct rtnl_link_stats64 *_res,
3357 const struct rtnl_link_stats64 *_new,
3358 const struct rtnl_link_stats64 *_old)
3359{
3360 const u64 *new = (const u64 *)_new;
3361 const u64 *old = (const u64 *)_old;
3362 u64 *res = (u64 *)_res;
3363 int i;
3364
3365 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(*_res) / sizeof(u64); i++) {
3366 u64 nv = new[i];
3367 u64 ov = old[i];
3368 s64 delta = nv - ov;
3369
3370 /* detects if this particular field is 32bit only */
3371 if (((nv | ov) >> 32) == 0)
3372 delta = (s64)(s32)((u32)nv - (u32)ov);
3373
3374 /* filter anomalies, some drivers reset their stats
3375 * at down/up events.
3376 */
3377 if (delta > 0)
3378 res[i] += delta;
3379 }
3380}
3381
3382static void bond_get_stats(struct net_device *bond_dev,
3383 struct rtnl_link_stats64 *stats)
3384{
3385 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3386 struct rtnl_link_stats64 temp;
3387 struct list_head *iter;
3388 struct slave *slave;
3389
3390 spin_lock(&bond->stats_lock);
3391 memcpy(stats, &bond->bond_stats, sizeof(*stats));
3392
3393 rcu_read_lock();
3394 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
3395 const struct rtnl_link_stats64 *new =
3396 dev_get_stats(slave->dev, &temp);
3397
3398 bond_fold_stats(stats, new, &slave->slave_stats);
3399
3400 /* save off the slave stats for the next run */
3401 memcpy(&slave->slave_stats, new, sizeof(*new));
3402 }
3403 rcu_read_unlock();
3404
3405 memcpy(&bond->bond_stats, stats, sizeof(*stats));
3406 spin_unlock(&bond->stats_lock);
3407}
3408
3409static int bond_do_ioctl(struct net_device *bond_dev, struct ifreq *ifr, int cmd)
3410{
3411 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3412 struct net_device *slave_dev = NULL;
3413 struct ifbond k_binfo;
3414 struct ifbond __user *u_binfo = NULL;
3415 struct ifslave k_sinfo;
3416 struct ifslave __user *u_sinfo = NULL;
3417 struct mii_ioctl_data *mii = NULL;
3418 struct bond_opt_value newval;
3419 struct net *net;
3420 int res = 0;
3421
3422 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "bond_ioctl: cmd=%d\n", cmd);
3423
3424 switch (cmd) {
3425 case SIOCGMIIPHY:
3426 mii = if_mii(ifr);
3427 if (!mii)
3428 return -EINVAL;
3429
3430 mii->phy_id = 0;
3431 /* Fall Through */
3432 case SIOCGMIIREG:
3433 /* We do this again just in case we were called by SIOCGMIIREG
3434 * instead of SIOCGMIIPHY.
3435 */
3436 mii = if_mii(ifr);
3437 if (!mii)
3438 return -EINVAL;
3439
3440 if (mii->reg_num == 1) {
3441 mii->val_out = 0;
3442 if (netif_carrier_ok(bond->dev))
3443 mii->val_out = BMSR_LSTATUS;
3444 }
3445
3446 return 0;
3447 case BOND_INFO_QUERY_OLD:
3448 case SIOCBONDINFOQUERY:
3449 u_binfo = (struct ifbond __user *)ifr->ifr_data;
3450
3451 if (copy_from_user(&k_binfo, u_binfo, sizeof(ifbond)))
3452 return -EFAULT;
3453
3454 bond_info_query(bond_dev, &k_binfo);
3455 if (copy_to_user(u_binfo, &k_binfo, sizeof(ifbond)))
3456 return -EFAULT;
3457
3458 return 0;
3459 case BOND_SLAVE_INFO_QUERY_OLD:
3460 case SIOCBONDSLAVEINFOQUERY:
3461 u_sinfo = (struct ifslave __user *)ifr->ifr_data;
3462
3463 if (copy_from_user(&k_sinfo, u_sinfo, sizeof(ifslave)))
3464 return -EFAULT;
3465
3466 res = bond_slave_info_query(bond_dev, &k_sinfo);
3467 if (res == 0 &&
3468 copy_to_user(u_sinfo, &k_sinfo, sizeof(ifslave)))
3469 return -EFAULT;
3470
3471 return res;
3472 default:
3473 break;
3474 }
3475
3476 net = dev_net(bond_dev);
3477
3478 if (!ns_capable(net->user_ns, CAP_NET_ADMIN))
3479 return -EPERM;
3480
3481 slave_dev = __dev_get_by_name(net, ifr->ifr_slave);
3482
3483 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "slave_dev=%p:\n", slave_dev);
3484
3485 if (!slave_dev)
3486 return -ENODEV;
3487
3488 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "slave_dev->name=%s:\n", slave_dev->name);
3489 switch (cmd) {
3490 case BOND_ENSLAVE_OLD:
3491 case SIOCBONDENSLAVE:
3492 res = bond_enslave(bond_dev, slave_dev);
3493 break;
3494 case BOND_RELEASE_OLD:
3495 case SIOCBONDRELEASE:
3496 res = bond_release(bond_dev, slave_dev);
3497 break;
3498 case BOND_SETHWADDR_OLD:
3499 case SIOCBONDSETHWADDR:
3500 bond_set_dev_addr(bond_dev, slave_dev);
3501 res = 0;
3502 break;
3503 case BOND_CHANGE_ACTIVE_OLD:
3504 case SIOCBONDCHANGEACTIVE:
3505 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, slave_dev->name);
3506 res = __bond_opt_set_notify(bond, BOND_OPT_ACTIVE_SLAVE,
3507 &newval);
3508 break;
3509 default:
3510 res = -EOPNOTSUPP;
3511 }
3512
3513 return res;
3514}
3515
3516static void bond_change_rx_flags(struct net_device *bond_dev, int change)
3517{
3518 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3519
3520 if (change & IFF_PROMISC)
3521 bond_set_promiscuity(bond,
3522 bond_dev->flags & IFF_PROMISC ? 1 : -1);
3523
3524 if (change & IFF_ALLMULTI)
3525 bond_set_allmulti(bond,
3526 bond_dev->flags & IFF_ALLMULTI ? 1 : -1);
3527}
3528
3529static void bond_set_rx_mode(struct net_device *bond_dev)
3530{
3531 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3532 struct list_head *iter;
3533 struct slave *slave;
3534
3535 rcu_read_lock();
3536 if (bond_uses_primary(bond)) {
3537 slave = rcu_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave);
3538 if (slave) {
3539 dev_uc_sync(slave->dev, bond_dev);
3540 dev_mc_sync(slave->dev, bond_dev);
3541 }
3542 } else {
3543 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
3544 dev_uc_sync_multiple(slave->dev, bond_dev);
3545 dev_mc_sync_multiple(slave->dev, bond_dev);
3546 }
3547 }
3548 rcu_read_unlock();
3549}
3550
3551static int bond_neigh_init(struct neighbour *n)
3552{
3553 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(n->dev);
3554 const struct net_device_ops *slave_ops;
3555 struct neigh_parms parms;
3556 struct slave *slave;
3557 int ret;
3558
3559 slave = bond_first_slave(bond);
3560 if (!slave)
3561 return 0;
3562 slave_ops = slave->dev->netdev_ops;
3563 if (!slave_ops->ndo_neigh_setup)
3564 return 0;
3565
3566 parms.neigh_setup = NULL;
3567 parms.neigh_cleanup = NULL;
3568 ret = slave_ops->ndo_neigh_setup(slave->dev, &parms);
3569 if (ret)
3570 return ret;
3571
3572 /* Assign slave's neigh_cleanup to neighbour in case cleanup is called
3573 * after the last slave has been detached. Assumes that all slaves
3574 * utilize the same neigh_cleanup (true at this writing as only user
3575 * is ipoib).
3576 */
3577 n->parms->neigh_cleanup = parms.neigh_cleanup;
3578
3579 if (!parms.neigh_setup)
3580 return 0;
3581
3582 return parms.neigh_setup(n);
3583}
3584
3585/* The bonding ndo_neigh_setup is called at init time beofre any
3586 * slave exists. So we must declare proxy setup function which will
3587 * be used at run time to resolve the actual slave neigh param setup.
3588 *
3589 * It's also called by master devices (such as vlans) to setup their
3590 * underlying devices. In that case - do nothing, we're already set up from
3591 * our init.
3592 */
3593static int bond_neigh_setup(struct net_device *dev,
3594 struct neigh_parms *parms)
3595{
3596 /* modify only our neigh_parms */
3597 if (parms->dev == dev)
3598 parms->neigh_setup = bond_neigh_init;
3599
3600 return 0;
3601}
3602
3603/* Change the MTU of all of a master's slaves to match the master */
3604static int bond_change_mtu(struct net_device *bond_dev, int new_mtu)
3605{
3606 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3607 struct slave *slave, *rollback_slave;
3608 struct list_head *iter;
3609 int res = 0;
3610
3611 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "bond=%p, new_mtu=%d\n", bond, new_mtu);
3612
3613 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
3614 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "s %p c_m %p\n",
3615 slave, slave->dev->netdev_ops->ndo_change_mtu);
3616
3617 res = dev_set_mtu(slave->dev, new_mtu);
3618
3619 if (res) {
3620 /* If we failed to set the slave's mtu to the new value
3621 * we must abort the operation even in ACTIVE_BACKUP
3622 * mode, because if we allow the backup slaves to have
3623 * different mtu values than the active slave we'll
3624 * need to change their mtu when doing a failover. That
3625 * means changing their mtu from timer context, which
3626 * is probably not a good idea.
3627 */
3628 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "err %d %s\n", res,
3629 slave->dev->name);
3630 goto unwind;
3631 }
3632 }
3633
3634 bond_dev->mtu = new_mtu;
3635
3636 return 0;
3637
3638unwind:
3639 /* unwind from head to the slave that failed */
3640 bond_for_each_slave(bond, rollback_slave, iter) {
3641 int tmp_res;
3642
3643 if (rollback_slave == slave)
3644 break;
3645
3646 tmp_res = dev_set_mtu(rollback_slave->dev, bond_dev->mtu);
3647 if (tmp_res) {
3648 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "unwind err %d dev %s\n",
3649 tmp_res, rollback_slave->dev->name);
3650 }
3651 }
3652
3653 return res;
3654}
3655
3656/* Change HW address
3657 *
3658 * Note that many devices must be down to change the HW address, and
3659 * downing the master releases all slaves. We can make bonds full of
3660 * bonding devices to test this, however.
3661 */
3662static int bond_set_mac_address(struct net_device *bond_dev, void *addr)
3663{
3664 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3665 struct slave *slave, *rollback_slave;
3666 struct sockaddr_storage *ss = addr, tmp_ss;
3667 struct list_head *iter;
3668 int res = 0;
3669
3670 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_ALB)
3671 return bond_alb_set_mac_address(bond_dev, addr);
3672
3673
3674 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "bond=%p\n", bond);
3675
3676 /* If fail_over_mac is enabled, do nothing and return success.
3677 * Returning an error causes ifenslave to fail.
3678 */
3679 if (bond->params.fail_over_mac &&
3680 BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_ACTIVEBACKUP)
3681 return 0;
3682
3683 if (!is_valid_ether_addr(ss->__data))
3684 return -EADDRNOTAVAIL;
3685
3686 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
3687 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "slave %p %s\n", slave, slave->dev->name);
3688 res = dev_set_mac_address(slave->dev, addr);
3689 if (res) {
3690 /* TODO: consider downing the slave
3691 * and retry ?
3692 * User should expect communications
3693 * breakage anyway until ARP finish
3694 * updating, so...
3695 */
3696 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "err %d %s\n", res, slave->dev->name);
3697 goto unwind;
3698 }
3699 }
3700
3701 /* success */
3702 memcpy(bond_dev->dev_addr, ss->__data, bond_dev->addr_len);
3703 return 0;
3704
3705unwind:
3706 memcpy(tmp_ss.__data, bond_dev->dev_addr, bond_dev->addr_len);
3707 tmp_ss.ss_family = bond_dev->type;
3708
3709 /* unwind from head to the slave that failed */
3710 bond_for_each_slave(bond, rollback_slave, iter) {
3711 int tmp_res;
3712
3713 if (rollback_slave == slave)
3714 break;
3715
3716 tmp_res = dev_set_mac_address(rollback_slave->dev,
3717 (struct sockaddr *)&tmp_ss);
3718 if (tmp_res) {
3719 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "unwind err %d dev %s\n",
3720 tmp_res, rollback_slave->dev->name);
3721 }
3722 }
3723
3724 return res;
3725}
3726
3727/**
3728 * bond_xmit_slave_id - transmit skb through slave with slave_id
3729 * @bond: bonding device that is transmitting
3730 * @skb: buffer to transmit
3731 * @slave_id: slave id up to slave_cnt-1 through which to transmit
3732 *
3733 * This function tries to transmit through slave with slave_id but in case
3734 * it fails, it tries to find the first available slave for transmission.
3735 * The skb is consumed in all cases, thus the function is void.
3736 */
3737static void bond_xmit_slave_id(struct bonding *bond, struct sk_buff *skb, int slave_id)
3738{
3739 struct list_head *iter;
3740 struct slave *slave;
3741 int i = slave_id;
3742
3743 /* Here we start from the slave with slave_id */
3744 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
3745 if (--i < 0) {
3746 if (bond_slave_can_tx(slave)) {
3747 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
3748 return;
3749 }
3750 }
3751 }
3752
3753 /* Here we start from the first slave up to slave_id */
3754 i = slave_id;
3755 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
3756 if (--i < 0)
3757 break;
3758 if (bond_slave_can_tx(slave)) {
3759 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
3760 return;
3761 }
3762 }
3763 /* no slave that can tx has been found */
3764 bond_tx_drop(bond->dev, skb);
3765}
3766
3767/**
3768 * bond_rr_gen_slave_id - generate slave id based on packets_per_slave
3769 * @bond: bonding device to use
3770 *
3771 * Based on the value of the bonding device's packets_per_slave parameter
3772 * this function generates a slave id, which is usually used as the next
3773 * slave to transmit through.
3774 */
3775static u32 bond_rr_gen_slave_id(struct bonding *bond)
3776{
3777 u32 slave_id;
3778 struct reciprocal_value reciprocal_packets_per_slave;
3779 int packets_per_slave = bond->params.packets_per_slave;
3780
3781 switch (packets_per_slave) {
3782 case 0:
3783 slave_id = prandom_u32();
3784 break;
3785 case 1:
3786 slave_id = bond->rr_tx_counter;
3787 break;
3788 default:
3789 reciprocal_packets_per_slave =
3790 bond->params.reciprocal_packets_per_slave;
3791 slave_id = reciprocal_divide(bond->rr_tx_counter,
3792 reciprocal_packets_per_slave);
3793 break;
3794 }
3795 bond->rr_tx_counter++;
3796
3797 return slave_id;
3798}
3799
3800static int bond_xmit_roundrobin(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *bond_dev)
3801{
3802 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3803 struct iphdr *iph = ip_hdr(skb);
3804 struct slave *slave;
3805 u32 slave_id;
3806
3807 /* Start with the curr_active_slave that joined the bond as the
3808 * default for sending IGMP traffic. For failover purposes one
3809 * needs to maintain some consistency for the interface that will
3810 * send the join/membership reports. The curr_active_slave found
3811 * will send all of this type of traffic.
3812 */
3813 if (iph->protocol == IPPROTO_IGMP && skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IP)) {
3814 slave = rcu_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave);
3815 if (slave)
3816 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
3817 else
3818 bond_xmit_slave_id(bond, skb, 0);
3819 } else {
3820 int slave_cnt = ACCESS_ONCE(bond->slave_cnt);
3821
3822 if (likely(slave_cnt)) {
3823 slave_id = bond_rr_gen_slave_id(bond);
3824 bond_xmit_slave_id(bond, skb, slave_id % slave_cnt);
3825 } else {
3826 bond_tx_drop(bond_dev, skb);
3827 }
3828 }
3829
3830 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
3831}
3832
3833/* In active-backup mode, we know that bond->curr_active_slave is always valid if
3834 * the bond has a usable interface.
3835 */
3836static int bond_xmit_activebackup(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *bond_dev)
3837{
3838 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3839 struct slave *slave;
3840
3841 slave = rcu_dereference(bond->curr_active_slave);
3842 if (slave)
3843 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
3844 else
3845 bond_tx_drop(bond_dev, skb);
3846
3847 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
3848}
3849
3850/* Use this to update slave_array when (a) it's not appropriate to update
3851 * slave_array right away (note that update_slave_array() may sleep)
3852 * and / or (b) RTNL is not held.
3853 */
3854void bond_slave_arr_work_rearm(struct bonding *bond, unsigned long delay)
3855{
3856 queue_delayed_work(bond->wq, &bond->slave_arr_work, delay);
3857}
3858
3859/* Slave array work handler. Holds only RTNL */
3860static void bond_slave_arr_handler(struct work_struct *work)
3861{
3862 struct bonding *bond = container_of(work, struct bonding,
3863 slave_arr_work.work);
3864 int ret;
3865
3866 if (!rtnl_trylock())
3867 goto err;
3868
3869 ret = bond_update_slave_arr(bond, NULL);
3870 rtnl_unlock();
3871 if (ret) {
3872 pr_warn_ratelimited("Failed to update slave array from WT\n");
3873 goto err;
3874 }
3875 return;
3876
3877err:
3878 bond_slave_arr_work_rearm(bond, 1);
3879}
3880
3881/* Build the usable slaves array in control path for modes that use xmit-hash
3882 * to determine the slave interface -
3883 * (a) BOND_MODE_8023AD
3884 * (b) BOND_MODE_XOR
3885 * (c) BOND_MODE_TLB && tlb_dynamic_lb == 0
3886 *
3887 * The caller is expected to hold RTNL only and NO other lock!
3888 */
3889int bond_update_slave_arr(struct bonding *bond, struct slave *skipslave)
3890{
3891 struct slave *slave;
3892 struct list_head *iter;
3893 struct bond_up_slave *new_arr, *old_arr;
3894 int agg_id = 0;
3895 int ret = 0;
3896
3897#ifdef CONFIG_LOCKDEP
3898 WARN_ON(lockdep_is_held(&bond->mode_lock));
3899#endif
3900
3901 new_arr = kzalloc(offsetof(struct bond_up_slave, arr[bond->slave_cnt]),
3902 GFP_KERNEL);
3903 if (!new_arr) {
3904 ret = -ENOMEM;
3905 pr_err("Failed to build slave-array.\n");
3906 goto out;
3907 }
3908 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_8023AD) {
3909 struct ad_info ad_info;
3910
3911 if (bond_3ad_get_active_agg_info(bond, &ad_info)) {
3912 pr_debug("bond_3ad_get_active_agg_info failed\n");
3913 kfree_rcu(new_arr, rcu);
3914 /* No active aggragator means it's not safe to use
3915 * the previous array.
3916 */
3917 old_arr = rtnl_dereference(bond->slave_arr);
3918 if (old_arr) {
3919 RCU_INIT_POINTER(bond->slave_arr, NULL);
3920 kfree_rcu(old_arr, rcu);
3921 }
3922 goto out;
3923 }
3924 agg_id = ad_info.aggregator_id;
3925 }
3926 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
3927 if (BOND_MODE(bond) == BOND_MODE_8023AD) {
3928 struct aggregator *agg;
3929
3930 agg = SLAVE_AD_INFO(slave)->port.aggregator;
3931 if (!agg || agg->aggregator_identifier != agg_id)
3932 continue;
3933 }
3934 if (!bond_slave_can_tx(slave))
3935 continue;
3936 if (skipslave == slave)
3937 continue;
3938 new_arr->arr[new_arr->count++] = slave;
3939 }
3940
3941 old_arr = rtnl_dereference(bond->slave_arr);
3942 rcu_assign_pointer(bond->slave_arr, new_arr);
3943 if (old_arr)
3944 kfree_rcu(old_arr, rcu);
3945out:
3946 if (ret != 0 && skipslave) {
3947 int idx;
3948
3949 /* Rare situation where caller has asked to skip a specific
3950 * slave but allocation failed (most likely!). BTW this is
3951 * only possible when the call is initiated from
3952 * __bond_release_one(). In this situation; overwrite the
3953 * skipslave entry in the array with the last entry from the
3954 * array to avoid a situation where the xmit path may choose
3955 * this to-be-skipped slave to send a packet out.
3956 */
3957 old_arr = rtnl_dereference(bond->slave_arr);
3958 for (idx = 0; idx < old_arr->count; idx++) {
3959 if (skipslave == old_arr->arr[idx]) {
3960 old_arr->arr[idx] =
3961 old_arr->arr[old_arr->count-1];
3962 old_arr->count--;
3963 break;
3964 }
3965 }
3966 }
3967 return ret;
3968}
3969
3970/* Use this Xmit function for 3AD as well as XOR modes. The current
3971 * usable slave array is formed in the control path. The xmit function
3972 * just calculates hash and sends the packet out.
3973 */
3974static int bond_3ad_xor_xmit(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev)
3975{
3976 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(dev);
3977 struct slave *slave;
3978 struct bond_up_slave *slaves;
3979 unsigned int count;
3980
3981 slaves = rcu_dereference(bond->slave_arr);
3982 count = slaves ? ACCESS_ONCE(slaves->count) : 0;
3983 if (likely(count)) {
3984 slave = slaves->arr[bond_xmit_hash(bond, skb) % count];
3985 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
3986 } else {
3987 bond_tx_drop(dev, skb);
3988 }
3989
3990 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
3991}
3992
3993/* in broadcast mode, we send everything to all usable interfaces. */
3994static int bond_xmit_broadcast(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *bond_dev)
3995{
3996 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
3997 struct slave *slave = NULL;
3998 struct list_head *iter;
3999
4000 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
4001 if (bond_is_last_slave(bond, slave))
4002 break;
4003 if (bond_slave_is_up(slave) && slave->link == BOND_LINK_UP) {
4004 struct sk_buff *skb2 = skb_clone(skb, GFP_ATOMIC);
4005
4006 if (!skb2) {
4007 net_err_ratelimited("%s: Error: %s: skb_clone() failed\n",
4008 bond_dev->name, __func__);
4009 continue;
4010 }
4011 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb2, slave->dev);
4012 }
4013 }
4014 if (slave && bond_slave_is_up(slave) && slave->link == BOND_LINK_UP)
4015 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
4016 else
4017 bond_tx_drop(bond_dev, skb);
4018
4019 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
4020}
4021
4022/*------------------------- Device initialization ---------------------------*/
4023
4024/* Lookup the slave that corresponds to a qid */
4025static inline int bond_slave_override(struct bonding *bond,
4026 struct sk_buff *skb)
4027{
4028 struct slave *slave = NULL;
4029 struct list_head *iter;
4030
4031 if (!skb->queue_mapping)
4032 return 1;
4033
4034 /* Find out if any slaves have the same mapping as this skb. */
4035 bond_for_each_slave_rcu(bond, slave, iter) {
4036 if (slave->queue_id == skb->queue_mapping) {
4037 if (bond_slave_is_up(slave) &&
4038 slave->link == BOND_LINK_UP) {
4039 bond_dev_queue_xmit(bond, skb, slave->dev);
4040 return 0;
4041 }
4042 /* If the slave isn't UP, use default transmit policy. */
4043 break;
4044 }
4045 }
4046
4047 return 1;
4048}
4049
4050
4051static u16 bond_select_queue(struct net_device *dev, struct sk_buff *skb,
4052 void *accel_priv, select_queue_fallback_t fallback)
4053{
4054 /* This helper function exists to help dev_pick_tx get the correct
4055 * destination queue. Using a helper function skips a call to
4056 * skb_tx_hash and will put the skbs in the queue we expect on their
4057 * way down to the bonding driver.
4058 */
4059 u16 txq = skb_rx_queue_recorded(skb) ? skb_get_rx_queue(skb) : 0;
4060
4061 /* Save the original txq to restore before passing to the driver */
4062 qdisc_skb_cb(skb)->slave_dev_queue_mapping = skb->queue_mapping;
4063
4064 if (unlikely(txq >= dev->real_num_tx_queues)) {
4065 do {
4066 txq -= dev->real_num_tx_queues;
4067 } while (txq >= dev->real_num_tx_queues);
4068 }
4069 return txq;
4070}
4071
4072static netdev_tx_t __bond_start_xmit(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev)
4073{
4074 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(dev);
4075
4076 if (bond_should_override_tx_queue(bond) &&
4077 !bond_slave_override(bond, skb))
4078 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
4079
4080 switch (BOND_MODE(bond)) {
4081 case BOND_MODE_ROUNDROBIN:
4082 return bond_xmit_roundrobin(skb, dev);
4083 case BOND_MODE_ACTIVEBACKUP:
4084 return bond_xmit_activebackup(skb, dev);
4085 case BOND_MODE_8023AD:
4086 case BOND_MODE_XOR:
4087 return bond_3ad_xor_xmit(skb, dev);
4088 case BOND_MODE_BROADCAST:
4089 return bond_xmit_broadcast(skb, dev);
4090 case BOND_MODE_ALB:
4091 return bond_alb_xmit(skb, dev);
4092 case BOND_MODE_TLB:
4093 return bond_tlb_xmit(skb, dev);
4094 default:
4095 /* Should never happen, mode already checked */
4096 netdev_err(dev, "Unknown bonding mode %d\n", BOND_MODE(bond));
4097 WARN_ON_ONCE(1);
4098 bond_tx_drop(dev, skb);
4099 return NETDEV_TX_OK;
4100 }
4101}
4102
4103static netdev_tx_t bond_start_xmit(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev)
4104{
4105 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(dev);
4106 netdev_tx_t ret = NETDEV_TX_OK;
4107
4108 /* If we risk deadlock from transmitting this in the
4109 * netpoll path, tell netpoll to queue the frame for later tx
4110 */
4111 if (unlikely(is_netpoll_tx_blocked(dev)))
4112 return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
4113
4114 rcu_read_lock();
4115 if (bond_has_slaves(bond))
4116 ret = __bond_start_xmit(skb, dev);
4117 else
4118 bond_tx_drop(dev, skb);
4119 rcu_read_unlock();
4120
4121 return ret;
4122}
4123
4124static int bond_ethtool_get_link_ksettings(struct net_device *bond_dev,
4125 struct ethtool_link_ksettings *cmd)
4126{
4127 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4128 unsigned long speed = 0;
4129 struct list_head *iter;
4130 struct slave *slave;
4131
4132 cmd->base.duplex = DUPLEX_UNKNOWN;
4133 cmd->base.port = PORT_OTHER;
4134
4135 /* Since bond_slave_can_tx returns false for all inactive or down slaves, we
4136 * do not need to check mode. Though link speed might not represent
4137 * the true receive or transmit bandwidth (not all modes are symmetric)
4138 * this is an accurate maximum.
4139 */
4140 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter) {
4141 if (bond_slave_can_tx(slave)) {
4142 if (slave->speed != SPEED_UNKNOWN)
4143 speed += slave->speed;
4144 if (cmd->base.duplex == DUPLEX_UNKNOWN &&
4145 slave->duplex != DUPLEX_UNKNOWN)
4146 cmd->base.duplex = slave->duplex;
4147 }
4148 }
4149 cmd->base.speed = speed ? : SPEED_UNKNOWN;
4150
4151 return 0;
4152}
4153
4154static void bond_ethtool_get_drvinfo(struct net_device *bond_dev,
4155 struct ethtool_drvinfo *drvinfo)
4156{
4157 strlcpy(drvinfo->driver, DRV_NAME, sizeof(drvinfo->driver));
4158 strlcpy(drvinfo->version, DRV_VERSION, sizeof(drvinfo->version));
4159 snprintf(drvinfo->fw_version, sizeof(drvinfo->fw_version), "%d",
4160 BOND_ABI_VERSION);
4161}

4165 .get_link = ethtool_op_get_link,
4166 .get_link_ksettings = bond_ethtool_get_link_ksettings,
4167};

4196static const struct device_type bond_type = {
4197 .name = "bond",
4198};
4199
4200static void bond_destructor(struct net_device *bond_dev)
4201{
4202 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4203 if (bond->wq)
4204 destroy_workqueue(bond->wq);
4205}
4206
4207void bond_setup(struct net_device *bond_dev)
4208{
4209 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4210
4211 spin_lock_init(&bond->mode_lock);
4212 spin_lock_init(&bond->stats_lock);
4213 bond->params = bonding_defaults;
4214
4215 /* Initialize pointers */
4216 bond->dev = bond_dev;
4217
4218 /* Initialize the device entry points */
4219 ether_setup(bond_dev);
4220 bond_dev->max_mtu = ETH_MAX_MTU;
4221 bond_dev->netdev_ops = &bond_netdev_ops;
4222 bond_dev->ethtool_ops = &bond_ethtool_ops;
4223
4224 bond_dev->needs_free_netdev = true;
4225 bond_dev->priv_destructor = bond_destructor;
4226
4227 SET_NETDEV_DEVTYPE(bond_dev, &bond_type);
4228
4229 /* Initialize the device options */
4230 bond_dev->flags |= IFF_MASTER;
4231 bond_dev->priv_flags |= IFF_BONDING | IFF_UNICAST_FLT | IFF_NO_QUEUE;
4232 bond_dev->priv_flags &= ~(IFF_XMIT_DST_RELEASE | IFF_TX_SKB_SHARING);
4233
4234 /* don't acquire bond device's netif_tx_lock when transmitting */
4235 bond_dev->features |= NETIF_F_LLTX;
4236
4237 /* By default, we declare the bond to be fully
4238 * VLAN hardware accelerated capable. Special
4239 * care is taken in the various xmit functions
4240 * when there are slaves that are not hw accel
4241 * capable
4242 */
4243
4244 /* Don't allow bond devices to change network namespaces. */
4245 bond_dev->features |= NETIF_F_NETNS_LOCAL;
4246
4247 bond_dev->hw_features = BOND_VLAN_FEATURES |
4248 NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_CTAG_TX |
4249 NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_CTAG_RX |
4250 NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_CTAG_FILTER;
4251
4252 bond_dev->hw_features |= NETIF_F_GSO_ENCAP_ALL;
4253 bond_dev->features |= bond_dev->hw_features;
4254}
4255
4256/* Destroy a bonding device.
4257 * Must be under rtnl_lock when this function is called.
4258 */
4259static void bond_uninit(struct net_device *bond_dev)
4260{
4261 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4262 struct list_head *iter;
4263 struct slave *slave;
4264 struct bond_up_slave *arr;
4265
4266 bond_netpoll_cleanup(bond_dev);
4267
4268 /* Release the bonded slaves */
4269 bond_for_each_slave(bond, slave, iter)
4270 __bond_release_one(bond_dev, slave->dev, true, true);
4271 netdev_info(bond_dev, "Released all slaves\n");
4272
4273 arr = rtnl_dereference(bond->slave_arr);
4274 if (arr) {
4275 RCU_INIT_POINTER(bond->slave_arr, NULL);
4276 kfree_rcu(arr, rcu);
4277 }
4278
4279 list_del(&bond->bond_list);
4280
4281 bond_debug_unregister(bond);
4282}
4283
4284/*------------------------- Module initialization ---------------------------*/
4285
4286static int bond_check_params(struct bond_params *params)
4287{
4288 int arp_validate_value, fail_over_mac_value, primary_reselect_value, i;
4289 struct bond_opt_value newval;
4290 const struct bond_opt_value *valptr;
4291 int arp_all_targets_value = 0;
4292 u16 ad_actor_sys_prio = 0;
4293 u16 ad_user_port_key = 0;
4294 __be32 arp_target[BOND_MAX_ARP_TARGETS] = { 0 };
4295 int arp_ip_count;
4296 int bond_mode = BOND_MODE_ROUNDROBIN;
4297 int xmit_hashtype = BOND_XMIT_POLICY_LAYER2;
4298 int lacp_fast = 0;
4299 int tlb_dynamic_lb;
4300
4301 /* Convert string parameters. */
4302 if (mode) {
4303 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, mode);
4304 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_MODE), &newval);
4305 if (!valptr) {
4306 pr_err("Error: Invalid bonding mode \"%s\"\n", mode);
4307 return -EINVAL;
4308 }
4309 bond_mode = valptr->value;
4310 }
4311
4312 if (xmit_hash_policy) {
4313 if ((bond_mode != BOND_MODE_XOR) &&
4314 (bond_mode != BOND_MODE_8023AD) &&
4315 (bond_mode != BOND_MODE_TLB)) {
4316 pr_info("xmit_hash_policy param is irrelevant in mode %s\n",
4317 bond_mode_name(bond_mode));
4318 } else {
4319 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, xmit_hash_policy);
4320 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_XMIT_HASH),
4321 &newval);
4322 if (!valptr) {
4323 pr_err("Error: Invalid xmit_hash_policy \"%s\"\n",
4324 xmit_hash_policy);
4325 return -EINVAL;
4326 }
4327 xmit_hashtype = valptr->value;
4328 }
4329 }
4330
4331 if (lacp_rate) {
4332 if (bond_mode != BOND_MODE_8023AD) {
4333 pr_info("lacp_rate param is irrelevant in mode %s\n",
4334 bond_mode_name(bond_mode));
4335 } else {
4336 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, lacp_rate);
4337 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_LACP_RATE),
4338 &newval);
4339 if (!valptr) {
4340 pr_err("Error: Invalid lacp rate \"%s\"\n",
4341 lacp_rate);
4342 return -EINVAL;
4343 }
4344 lacp_fast = valptr->value;
4345 }
4346 }
4347
4348 if (ad_select) {
4349 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, ad_select);
4350 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_AD_SELECT),
4351 &newval);
4352 if (!valptr) {
4353 pr_err("Error: Invalid ad_select \"%s\"\n", ad_select);
4354 return -EINVAL;
4355 }
4356 params->ad_select = valptr->value;
4357 if (bond_mode != BOND_MODE_8023AD)
4358 pr_warn("ad_select param only affects 802.3ad mode\n");
4359 } else {
4360 params->ad_select = BOND_AD_STABLE;
4361 }
4362
4363 if (max_bonds < 0) {
4364 pr_warn("Warning: max_bonds (%d) not in range %d-%d, so it was reset to BOND_DEFAULT_MAX_BONDS (%d)\n",
4365 max_bonds, 0, INT_MAX, BOND_DEFAULT_MAX_BONDS);
4366 max_bonds = BOND_DEFAULT_MAX_BONDS;
4367 }
4368
4369 if (miimon < 0) {
4370 pr_warn("Warning: miimon module parameter (%d), not in range 0-%d, so it was reset to 0\n",
4371 miimon, INT_MAX);
4372 miimon = 0;
4373 }
4374
4375 if (updelay < 0) {
4376 pr_warn("Warning: updelay module parameter (%d), not in range 0-%d, so it was reset to 0\n",
4377 updelay, INT_MAX);
4378 updelay = 0;
4379 }
4380
4381 if (downdelay < 0) {
4382 pr_warn("Warning: downdelay module parameter (%d), not in range 0-%d, so it was reset to 0\n",
4383 downdelay, INT_MAX);
4384 downdelay = 0;
4385 }
4386
4387 if ((use_carrier != 0) && (use_carrier != 1)) {
4388 pr_warn("Warning: use_carrier module parameter (%d), not of valid value (0/1), so it was set to 1\n",
4389 use_carrier);
4390 use_carrier = 1;
4391 }
4392
4393 if (num_peer_notif < 0 || num_peer_notif > 255) {
4394 pr_warn("Warning: num_grat_arp/num_unsol_na (%d) not in range 0-255 so it was reset to 1\n",
4395 num_peer_notif);
4396 num_peer_notif = 1;
4397 }
4398
4399 /* reset values for 802.3ad/TLB/ALB */
4400 if (!bond_mode_uses_arp(bond_mode)) {
4401 if (!miimon) {
4402 pr_warn("Warning: miimon must be specified, otherwise bonding will not detect link failure, speed and duplex which are essential for 802.3ad operation\n");
4403 pr_warn("Forcing miimon to 100msec\n");
4404 miimon = BOND_DEFAULT_MIIMON;
4405 }
4406 }
4407
4408 if (tx_queues < 1 || tx_queues > 255) {
4409 pr_warn("Warning: tx_queues (%d) should be between 1 and 255, resetting to %d\n",
4410 tx_queues, BOND_DEFAULT_TX_QUEUES);
4411 tx_queues = BOND_DEFAULT_TX_QUEUES;
4412 }
4413
4414 if ((all_slaves_active != 0) && (all_slaves_active != 1)) {
4415 pr_warn("Warning: all_slaves_active module parameter (%d), not of valid value (0/1), so it was set to 0\n",
4416 all_slaves_active);
4417 all_slaves_active = 0;
4418 }
4419
4420 if (resend_igmp < 0 || resend_igmp > 255) {
4421 pr_warn("Warning: resend_igmp (%d) should be between 0 and 255, resetting to %d\n",
4422 resend_igmp, BOND_DEFAULT_RESEND_IGMP);
4423 resend_igmp = BOND_DEFAULT_RESEND_IGMP;
4424 }
4425
4426 bond_opt_initval(&newval, packets_per_slave);
4427 if (!bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_PACKETS_PER_SLAVE), &newval)) {
4428 pr_warn("Warning: packets_per_slave (%d) should be between 0 and %u resetting to 1\n",
4429 packets_per_slave, USHRT_MAX);
4430 packets_per_slave = 1;
4431 }
4432
4433 if (bond_mode == BOND_MODE_ALB) {
4434 pr_notice("In ALB mode you might experience client disconnections upon reconnection of a link if the bonding module updelay parameter (%d msec) is incompatible with the forwarding delay time of the switch\n",
4435 updelay);
4436 }
4437
4438 if (!miimon) {
4439 if (updelay || downdelay) {
4440 /* just warn the user the up/down delay will have
4441 * no effect since miimon is zero...
4442 */
4443 pr_warn("Warning: miimon module parameter not set and updelay (%d) or downdelay (%d) module parameter is set; updelay and downdelay have no effect unless miimon is set\n",
4444 updelay, downdelay);
4445 }
4446 } else {
4447 /* don't allow arp monitoring */
4448 if (arp_interval) {
4449 pr_warn("Warning: miimon (%d) and arp_interval (%d) can't be used simultaneously, disabling ARP monitoring\n",
4450 miimon, arp_interval);
4451 arp_interval = 0;
4452 }
4453
4454 if ((updelay % miimon) != 0) {
4455 pr_warn("Warning: updelay (%d) is not a multiple of miimon (%d), updelay rounded to %d ms\n",
4456 updelay, miimon, (updelay / miimon) * miimon);
4457 }
4458
4459 updelay /= miimon;
4460
4461 if ((downdelay % miimon) != 0) {
4462 pr_warn("Warning: downdelay (%d) is not a multiple of miimon (%d), downdelay rounded to %d ms\n",
4463 downdelay, miimon,
4464 (downdelay / miimon) * miimon);
4465 }
4466
4467 downdelay /= miimon;
4468 }
4469
4470 if (arp_interval < 0) {
4471 pr_warn("Warning: arp_interval module parameter (%d), not in range 0-%d, so it was reset to 0\n",
4472 arp_interval, INT_MAX);
4473 arp_interval = 0;
4474 }
4475
4476 for (arp_ip_count = 0, i = 0;
4477 (arp_ip_count < BOND_MAX_ARP_TARGETS) && arp_ip_target[i]; i++) {
4478 __be32 ip;
4479
4480 /* not a complete check, but good enough to catch mistakes */
4481 if (!in4_pton(arp_ip_target[i], -1, (u8 *)&ip, -1, NULL) ||
4482 !bond_is_ip_target_ok(ip)) {
4483 pr_warn("Warning: bad arp_ip_target module parameter (%s), ARP monitoring will not be performed\n",
4484 arp_ip_target[i]);
4485 arp_interval = 0;
4486 } else {
4487 if (bond_get_targets_ip(arp_target, ip) == -1)
4488 arp_target[arp_ip_count++] = ip;
4489 else
4490 pr_warn("Warning: duplicate address %pI4 in arp_ip_target, skipping\n",
4491 &ip);
4492 }
4493 }
4494
4495 if (arp_interval && !arp_ip_count) {
4496 /* don't allow arping if no arp_ip_target given... */
4497 pr_warn("Warning: arp_interval module parameter (%d) specified without providing an arp_ip_target parameter, arp_interval was reset to 0\n",
4498 arp_interval);
4499 arp_interval = 0;
4500 }
4501
4502 if (arp_validate) {
4503 if (!arp_interval) {
4504 pr_err("arp_validate requires arp_interval\n");
4505 return -EINVAL;
4506 }
4507
4508 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, arp_validate);
4509 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_ARP_VALIDATE),
4510 &newval);
4511 if (!valptr) {
4512 pr_err("Error: invalid arp_validate \"%s\"\n",
4513 arp_validate);
4514 return -EINVAL;
4515 }
4516 arp_validate_value = valptr->value;
4517 } else {
4518 arp_validate_value = 0;
4519 }
4520
4521 if (arp_all_targets) {
4522 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, arp_all_targets);
4523 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_ARP_ALL_TARGETS),
4524 &newval);
4525 if (!valptr) {
4526 pr_err("Error: invalid arp_all_targets_value \"%s\"\n",
4527 arp_all_targets);
4528 arp_all_targets_value = 0;
4529 } else {
4530 arp_all_targets_value = valptr->value;
4531 }
4532 }
4533
4534 if (miimon) {
4535 pr_info("MII link monitoring set to %d ms\n", miimon);
4536 } else if (arp_interval) {
4537 valptr = bond_opt_get_val(BOND_OPT_ARP_VALIDATE,
4538 arp_validate_value);
4539 pr_info("ARP monitoring set to %d ms, validate %s, with %d target(s):",
4540 arp_interval, valptr->string, arp_ip_count);
4541
4542 for (i = 0; i < arp_ip_count; i++)
4543 pr_cont(" %s", arp_ip_target[i]);
4544
4545 pr_cont("\n");
4546
4547 } else if (max_bonds) {
4548 /* miimon and arp_interval not set, we need one so things
4549 * work as expected, see bonding.txt for details
4550 */
4551 pr_debug("Warning: either miimon or arp_interval and arp_ip_target module parameters must be specified, otherwise bonding will not detect link failures! see bonding.txt for details\n");
4552 }
4553
4554 if (primary && !bond_mode_uses_primary(bond_mode)) {
4555 /* currently, using a primary only makes sense
4556 * in active backup, TLB or ALB modes
4557 */
4558 pr_warn("Warning: %s primary device specified but has no effect in %s mode\n",
4559 primary, bond_mode_name(bond_mode));
4560 primary = NULL;
4561 }
4562
4563 if (primary && primary_reselect) {
4564 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, primary_reselect);
4565 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_PRIMARY_RESELECT),
4566 &newval);
4567 if (!valptr) {
4568 pr_err("Error: Invalid primary_reselect \"%s\"\n",
4569 primary_reselect);
4570 return -EINVAL;
4571 }
4572 primary_reselect_value = valptr->value;
4573 } else {
4574 primary_reselect_value = BOND_PRI_RESELECT_ALWAYS;
4575 }
4576
4577 if (fail_over_mac) {
4578 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, fail_over_mac);
4579 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_FAIL_OVER_MAC),
4580 &newval);
4581 if (!valptr) {
4582 pr_err("Error: invalid fail_over_mac \"%s\"\n",
4583 fail_over_mac);
4584 return -EINVAL;
4585 }
4586 fail_over_mac_value = valptr->value;
4587 if (bond_mode != BOND_MODE_ACTIVEBACKUP)
4588 pr_warn("Warning: fail_over_mac only affects active-backup mode\n");
4589 } else {
4590 fail_over_mac_value = BOND_FOM_NONE;
4591 }
4592
4593 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, "default");
4594 valptr = bond_opt_parse(
4595 bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_AD_ACTOR_SYS_PRIO),
4596 &newval);
4597 if (!valptr) {
4598 pr_err("Error: No ad_actor_sys_prio default value");
4599 return -EINVAL;
4600 }
4601 ad_actor_sys_prio = valptr->value;
4602
4603 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_AD_USER_PORT_KEY),
4604 &newval);
4605 if (!valptr) {
4606 pr_err("Error: No ad_user_port_key default value");
4607 return -EINVAL;
4608 }
4609 ad_user_port_key = valptr->value;
4610
4611 bond_opt_initstr(&newval, "default");
4612 valptr = bond_opt_parse(bond_opt_get(BOND_OPT_TLB_DYNAMIC_LB), &newval);
4613 if (!valptr) {
4614 pr_err("Error: No tlb_dynamic_lb default value");
4615 return -EINVAL;
4616 }
4617 tlb_dynamic_lb = valptr->value;
4618
4619 if (lp_interval == 0) {
4620 pr_warn("Warning: ip_interval must be between 1 and %d, so it was reset to %d\n",
4621 INT_MAX, BOND_ALB_DEFAULT_LP_INTERVAL);
4622 lp_interval = BOND_ALB_DEFAULT_LP_INTERVAL;
4623 }
4624
4625 /* fill params struct with the proper values */
4626 params->mode = bond_mode;
4627 params->xmit_policy = xmit_hashtype;
4628 params->miimon = miimon;
4629 params->num_peer_notif = num_peer_notif;
4630 params->arp_interval = arp_interval;
4631 params->arp_validate = arp_validate_value;
4632 params->arp_all_targets = arp_all_targets_value;
4633 params->updelay = updelay;
4634 params->downdelay = downdelay;
4635 params->use_carrier = use_carrier;
4636 params->lacp_fast = lacp_fast;
4637 params->primary[0] = 0;
4638 params->primary_reselect = primary_reselect_value;
4639 params->fail_over_mac = fail_over_mac_value;
4640 params->tx_queues = tx_queues;
4641 params->all_slaves_active = all_slaves_active;
4642 params->resend_igmp = resend_igmp;
4643 params->min_links = min_links;
4644 params->lp_interval = lp_interval;
4645 params->packets_per_slave = packets_per_slave;
4646 params->tlb_dynamic_lb = tlb_dynamic_lb;
4647 params->ad_actor_sys_prio = ad_actor_sys_prio;
4648 eth_zero_addr(params->ad_actor_system);
4649 params->ad_user_port_key = ad_user_port_key;
4650 if (packets_per_slave > 0) {
4651 params->reciprocal_packets_per_slave =
4652 reciprocal_value(packets_per_slave);
4653 } else {
4654 /* reciprocal_packets_per_slave is unused if
4655 * packets_per_slave is 0 or 1, just initialize it
4656 */
4657 params->reciprocal_packets_per_slave =
4658 (struct reciprocal_value) { 0 };
4659 }
4660
4661 if (primary) {
4662 strncpy(params->primary, primary, IFNAMSIZ);
4663 params->primary[IFNAMSIZ - 1] = 0;
4664 }
4665
4666 memcpy(params->arp_targets, arp_target, sizeof(arp_target));
4667
4668 return 0;
4669}
4670
4671/* Called from registration process */
4672static int bond_init(struct net_device *bond_dev)
4673{
4674 struct bonding *bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4675 struct bond_net *bn = net_generic(dev_net(bond_dev), bond_net_id);
4676
4677 netdev_dbg(bond_dev, "Begin bond_init\n");
4678
4679 bond->wq = alloc_ordered_workqueue(bond_dev->name, WQ_MEM_RECLAIM);
4680 if (!bond->wq)
4681 return -ENOMEM;
4682
4683 netdev_lockdep_set_classes(bond_dev);
4684
4685 list_add_tail(&bond->bond_list, &bn->dev_list);
4686
4687 bond_prepare_sysfs_group(bond);
4688
4689 bond_debug_register(bond);
4690
4691 /* Ensure valid dev_addr */
4692 if (is_zero_ether_addr(bond_dev->dev_addr) &&
4693 bond_dev->addr_assign_type == NET_ADDR_PERM)
4694 eth_hw_addr_random(bond_dev);
4695
4696 return 0;
4697}
4698
4699unsigned int bond_get_num_tx_queues(void)
4700{
4701 return tx_queues;
4702}
4703
4704/* Create a new bond based on the specified name and bonding parameters.
4705 * If name is NULL, obtain a suitable "bond%d" name for us.
4706 * Caller must NOT hold rtnl_lock; we need to release it here before we
4707 * set up our sysfs entries.
4708 */
4709int bond_create(struct net *net, const char *name)
4710{
4711 struct net_device *bond_dev;
4712 struct bonding *bond;
4713 struct alb_bond_info *bond_info;
4714 int res;
4715
4716 rtnl_lock();
4717
4718 bond_dev = alloc_netdev_mq(sizeof(struct bonding),
4719 name ? name : "bond%d", NET_NAME_UNKNOWN,
4720 bond_setup, tx_queues);
4721 if (!bond_dev) {
4722 pr_err("%s: eek! can't alloc netdev!\n", name);
4723 rtnl_unlock();
4724 return -ENOMEM;
4725 }
4726
4727 /*
4728 * Initialize rx_hashtbl_used_head to RLB_NULL_INDEX.
4729 * It is set to 0 by default which is wrong.
4730 */
4731 bond = netdev_priv(bond_dev);
4732 bond_info = &(BOND_ALB_INFO(bond));
4733 bond_info->rx_hashtbl_used_head = RLB_NULL_INDEX;
4734
4735 dev_net_set(bond_dev, net);
4736 bond_dev->rtnl_link_ops = &bond_link_ops;
4737
4738 res = register_netdevice(bond_dev);
4739
4740 netif_carrier_off(bond_dev);
4741
4742 bond_work_init_all(bond);
4743
4744 rtnl_unlock();
4745 if (res < 0)
4746 free_netdev(bond_dev);
4747 return res;
4748}
4749
4750static int __net_init bond_net_init(struct net *net)
4751{
4752 struct bond_net *bn = net_generic(net, bond_net_id);
4753
4754 bn->net = net;
4755 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&bn->dev_list);
4756
4757 bond_create_proc_dir(bn);
4758 bond_create_sysfs(bn);
4759
4760 return 0;
4761}
4762
4763static void __net_exit bond_net_exit(struct net *net)
4764{
4765 struct bond_net *bn = net_generic(net, bond_net_id);
4766 struct bonding *bond, *tmp_bond;
4767 LIST_HEAD(list);
4768
4769 bond_destroy_sysfs(bn);
4770
4771 /* Kill off any bonds created after unregistering bond rtnl ops */
4772 rtnl_lock();
4773 list_for_each_entry_safe(bond, tmp_bond, &bn->dev_list, bond_list)
4774 unregister_netdevice_queue(bond->dev, &list);
4775 unregister_netdevice_many(&list);
4776 rtnl_unlock();
4777
4778 bond_destroy_proc_dir(bn);
4779}
4780
4781static struct pernet_operations bond_net_ops = {
4782 .init = bond_net_init,
4783 .exit = bond_net_exit,
4784 .id = &bond_net_id,
4785 .size = sizeof(struct bond_net),
4786};
4787
4788static int __init bonding_init(void)
4789{
4790 int i;
4791 int res;
4792
4793 pr_info("%s", bond_version);
4794
4795 res = bond_check_params(&bonding_defaults);
4796 if (res)
4797 goto out;
4798
4799 res = register_pernet_subsys(&bond_net_ops);
4800 if (res)
4801 goto out;
4802
4803 res = bond_netlink_init();
4804 if (res)
4805 goto err_link;
4806
4807 bond_create_debugfs();
4808
4809 for (i = 0; i < max_bonds; i++) {
4810 res = bond_create(&init_net, NULL);
4811 if (res)
4812 goto err;
4813 }
4814
4815 register_netdevice_notifier(&bond_netdev_notifier);
4816out:
4817 return res;
4818err:
4819 bond_destroy_debugfs();
4820 bond_netlink_fini();
4821err_link:
4822 unregister_pernet_subsys(&bond_net_ops);
4823 goto out;
4824
4825}
4826
4827static void __exit bonding_exit(void)
4828{
4829 unregister_netdevice_notifier(&bond_netdev_notifier);
4830
4831 bond_destroy_debugfs();
4832
4833 bond_netlink_fini();
4834 unregister_pernet_subsys(&bond_net_ops);
4835
4836#ifdef CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER
4837 /* Make sure we don't have an imbalance on our netpoll blocking */
4838 WARN_ON(atomic_read(&netpoll_block_tx));
4839#endif
4840}
4841
4842module_init(bonding_init);
4843module_exit(bonding_exit);
